trans-unit.source: Specifies authentication properties for the peer certificate.
Gets or sets the certificate validation mode.
A value from the enumeration in <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.X509CertificateValidationMode>.
Gets or sets a custom client certificate validator.

[!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] provides a default client certificate validator that verifies the client certificate against the trusted people store and also checks that the certificate chains up to a valid root.
A custom validator can be implemented to obtain a different behavior.
This property allows a custom validator to be specified.
The custom client certificate validator.
Set when credential is read-only.
Gets or sets the certificate revocation mode.
When using certificates, the system validates that the client certificate has not been revoked, by checking that the client certificate is not in the revoked certificate list.
This check can be performed either by checking online or by checking against a cached revocation list.
Revocation checking can be turned off by setting this property to NoCheck.

One of the values in <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode"></xref>: <xref uid="langword_csharp_NoCheck" name="NoCheck" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_Online" name="Online" href=""></xref>, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_Offline" name="Offline" href=""></xref>.
Set when credential is read-only.
Gets or sets the trusted store location where the client certificate is validated.

When using certificates, [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] security system validates the client certificate against a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.StoreLocation>.
The store location is specified using this parameter.
The trusted store location where the client certificate is validated.
Set when credential is read-only.
